title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <tekzilla> i thought it was something on the LDAP side, but the message sounded like what you described  
00:00 <tekzilla> which in my case made no sense as i ofc entered a username on the login page  
00:07 <tekzilla> but now i see directly after that message he says "Starting LDAP authentication" again, and then fails due to wrong ldap bind credentials, which might be true  
00:07 <tekzilla> i dont know how i could have missed that in the log before..  
00:08 <tekzilla> but the first thing i saw was this "user is null" so i started looking  
01:13 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:46 <tekzilla> has quit

06:17 <sdumitriu> has quit

07:57 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r6c6045c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/6c6045c0f522ca307d2045219511df9ee787ed62 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XE-1107: No need to indicate mysql-server, postgresql and tomcat6 ...  
09:56 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi. Could you finish voting on the Environment proposal? I have it done locally but would like more votes  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> O  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> OK  
11:07 <vmassol> thanks  
12:04 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:08 <helge> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <sdumitriu> has quit  
12:13 <helge> Hello all, I just wanted to let you know that my XE 3.4 installation with postgres 9.1 is running fine in a fresh install, clean database and patch in xwiki.nbm.xml applied. Other options discussed all led to the "invalid character" error.  
12:15 <helge> Another thing: something strange is going on on your news site (http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News). Maybe someone is doing something nasty? You might want to check. Regards, Helge.  
12:16 <vmassol> helge: what patch did you apply?  
12:17 <vmassol> do you have a jira issue where this is mentioned so that I could follow it?  
12:17 <helge> vmassol: the one Dumitiu recommended:  
12:17 <helge> <@sdumitriu> helge: Can you try one more thing? Extract xwiki.hbm.xml from WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-platform-legacy-oldcore-\*.jar into WEB-INF/classes and change the "content" property of the "XWikiRCSNodeContent" class from "materialized\_clob" to "text", then restart the server. It won't work for the existing history, but try to create a new document  
12:18 <vmassol> Ok thanks, is there a jira issue about this problem?  
12:18 <helge> sorry, no jira issue, just IRC discussion  
12:18 <vmassol> would be great if you could create one  
12:18 <vmassol> so that we can fix it  
12:19 <helge> I'll do the next days, when I got time to. Did you see your newssite?  
12:19 <vmassol> what site?  
12:19 <helge> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News  
12:20 <helge> I get a strange popup-message when I visit that site. Is that intended?  
12:20 <vmassol> fixing  
12:26 <vmassol> should be fixed now  
12:26 <vmassol> (helge)  
12:26 <vmassol> thanks for reporting  
12:26 <vmassol> :)  
12:26 <vmassol> someone was having some fun on xwiki.org  
12:30 <helge> looks better now. Hope you'r still having fun :)  
12:57 <kayasaman> has quit  
13:43 <+sburjan> I am running our UI tests on Windows + Firefox, and I see the attaachments tests are failing because the path on windows isn't constructred well for windows  
13:44 <+sburjan> does our ui-tests suite create a report after running all the tests so I can better see which tests have failed without to go through all the console messages ?  
13:49 <vmassol> yes you can see which tests have failed  
13:49 <vmassol> it's written in the console and the failed tests details are in target/surefire-reports  
13:49 <vmassol> (sburjan)  
14:06 <helge> has quit  
14:07 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* rb5fb31f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/b5fb31fd3c4085db2e9caceb6b77a72124be77f0 / (62 files in 28 dirs): XE-1110: Configuration files should be listed in conffiles file in ...  
14:24 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r2a197e2 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/2a197e2a1da954940d16060d456c6ecc3ca4d684 / xwiki-enterprise-installers/xwiki-enterprise-installer-debian/pom.xml : Use right version of jdeb - http://git.io/oyTjZQ  
14:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: I get a FF mdoal asking me to "Leave Page" or "stay on Page" .. that breaks some of my tests  
14:34 <vmassol> sburjan: yep I think tmortagne noticed those but nobody has fixed them yet. tmortagne?  
14:34 <vmassol> sburjan: could you create a jira issue about it?  
14:34 <vmassol> listing the exact tests that break  
14:35 <+sburjan> I will try, but I hangs at ome point, even if I "help" by pressing the "Leave Page"  
14:35 <+sburjan> I'll try running them all .. and then get the surefire report on a  JIRA issue  
14:38 <+sburjan> I see that all the WYSIWYG tests fail because of this  
14:38 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yep I reproduced them locally and they seem related to the WYSIWYG but I can't reproduce them in "normal" condition, only tests  
14:40 <+sburjan> might be related that the test jumps to another page using the our seleniu 2 API  while editing a page ?  
14:40 <+tmortagne> well I try to close the page or jump to another page and the WYSIWYG never complained  
14:40 <+tmortagne> so I'm not sure why it's working only during tests  
14:41 <+tmortagne> but in any case it's probably related to something selenium does  
14:41 <vmassol> two jobs stuck on jenkins, killing them, this happens all the time, we need to investigate  
14:41 <vmassol> tests-ui and manager  
14:44 <+sburjan> about making our ui tests to work on all browsers, I have started very small... and the first phase I want to investigate is which tests fail because of the operating system. Now I am running Windows + FF .. and all the attachments test fail because of the path generation. If we are able to fix this, and make our tests os independent, I can move to the next stage of runnning them on IE, Chrome, etc  
14:45 <+sburjan> IMO this is the best strategy, to fix the issues affecting windows ...  
14:45 <+sburjan> wdyt ?  
14:47 <vmassol> yes good  
15:02 <+sburjan> Tests run: 158, Failures: 12, Errors: 49, Skipped: 0  
15:03 <+sburjan> the list I will put on the JIRA is not 100% accurate. I will create 2 separate issues. one for the path generation on windows, and other for the Leave/Stay issue.  
15:46 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <jvelo> has quit  
15:52 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <+sburjan> vmassol: too bad sure-fire report doesn't list explicitly in a list which test failed, it seems I have to go manually through the whole stack and get them  
16:14 <vmassol> grep "ERROR" \*  
16:14 <vmassol> grep -H "ERROR" \*  
16:16 <+sburjan> thanks  
16:17 <+sburjan> creating issue now  
16:17 <+sburjan> I tried to get the list using surefire-report:report-only, but without success  
17:08 <+sburjan> cam someone tell me please if XWIKI-6526 is really fixed ?  
17:17 <vmassol> bot isn't working? hmmm  
17:19 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <vmassol> hmm bot is having problems  
17:19 <vmassol> no time to look  
17:19 <+tmortagne> s/iss really/is not really/  
17:19 <vmassol> if someone can chekc that would be great  
17:21 <+tmortagne> sburjan: and I don't think it has been fixed  
17:21 <+tmortagne> would need to ask jvelo to be sure  
17:23 <+sburjan> okay. thanks  
17:44 <sburjan> has quit  
17:55 <Kesarr> has joined #xwiki  
17:59 <Kesarr> Hi, I have a question about servlet path using XWiki 3.4.  
18:00 <Kesarr> I have seen the page about shorturl.  
18:01 <kayasaman> has joined #xwiki  
18:02 <Kesarr> It noticed that a servlet path 'wiki' is reserved for path based mutiwiki environment.  
18:07 <Kesarr> Are another servlet paths binded at ActionDispatcher like '/xwiki/\*' also reserved for any other usage or future?  
18:15 <Kesarr> In my XEM 3.4 (might equal to XE 3.4), servlete paths mapped at ActionDispatcher are '/bin/\*', '/wiki/\*', '/testbin/\*' and '/xwiki/\*'.  
18:16 <Kesarr> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/web.xml  
18:21 <+tmortagne> Kesarr: path based multiwiki is configurable, wiki is just the default  
18:22 <Kesarr> hmm...  
18:25 <Kesarr> tmortagne: I understand what you say, thank you.  
18:25 <+tmortagne> Kesarr: you'r welcome :)  
18:25 <Kesarr> Anyway, is /xwiki/\* reserved for other needs?  
18:26 <+tmortagne> you mean as in /xwiki/xwiki/ ?  
18:26 <Kesarr> yes!  
18:26 <+tmortagne> nothing I know  
18:27 <Kesarr> or context root set to '/'...  
18:27 <Kesarr> ah, but thanks :)  
18:28 <+tmortagne> I doubt we could use something like that  
18:28 <+tmortagne> especially because of the /xwiki/xwiki ;)  
18:30 <Kesarr> Sorry... my Enlish is very poor... As you say, "/xwiki/xwiki" is too strange?  
18:31 <+tmortagne> yep  
18:32 <Kesarr> I want to use "/" for context root, and "/xwiki/\*" for servlet path, and hidden view action.  
18:33 <+tmortagne> Kesarr: I think you are safe  
18:33 <Kesarr> I wish "http://blah.com/xwiki/Main/WebHome", right?  
18:34 <+tmortagne> "http://blah.com/xwiki/Main/", WebHome is the default page  
18:34 <+tmortagne> well not sure with short URL, don't know it very well  
18:35 <Kesarr> okay :) thank you very much, tmortagne.  
18:37 <+tmortagne> Kesarr: glad I could help :)  
18:45 <fmancinelli> has quit
